title: Justin Welby: Political leaders should treat opponents as human beings
description: The Archbishop of Canterbury urges politicians to "forswear wedge issues" and avoid divisive topics.

title: Almost three million tested for cancer in England
description: Record numbers are being tested for cancer but treatment targets are still being missed in England.

title: Household energy price rise of 5% comes into force
description: A higher cap for the next three months adds £94 to the typical annual domestic energy bill.

title: Primrose Hill stabbing: Harry Pitman named as stabbing victim
description: Harry Pitman, 16, was attacked on London's Primrose Hill where crowds had gathered to watch fireworks.

title: Israel Supreme Court strikes down judicial reforms
description: The controversial plans triggered nationwide protests last year against Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

title: Mother arrested over children? s deaths in US appears in UK court
description: Kimberlee Singler faces extradition to the US after being charged with murder and attempted murder.

title: Luke Littler, 16, charges into World Darts Championship semi-finals
description: Teenager Luke Littler powers through to the PDC World Darts Championship semi-finals with a 5-1 victory over Brendan Dolan.

title: Marvel star Jeremy Renner: I'm so blessed a year after accident
description: The Marvel star reflects on his recovery after being run over by his own snow plough last New Year's Day.

title: Japan earthquake: Powerful tremors destroy buildings and trigger evacuations
description: Dozens of buildings have collapsed in several towns, trapping an unknown number of people on New Year's Day.

title: Student's lost artwork found 4,000 miles away
description: Grace Hart feared losing her university place, until a Pakistan-based photographer got in touch.

title: Teenager killed in three-car collision on New Year's Day
description: An 18-year-old passenger was killed and three other people injured in the crash on New Year's Day.

title: Putin vows to 'intensify' attacks against Ukraine military targets
description: The Russian leader's comments come after days of aerial bombardment by both sides in the conflict.

title: We're a scapegoat for PPE failures, says Michelle Mone's husband
description: Doug Barrowman says his family has been "treated as a punchbag" for "lamentable failures" by ministers.

title: Man dies in shooting outside Granton pub before New Year bells
description: Another man is in hospital after what police described as a targeted attack at the Edinburgh bar.

title: Israel says war in Gaza expected to continue throughout 2024
description: In a new year message, Israel's military says it expects fighting in Gaza for the rest of the year.

title: Newspaper headlines: Cost of Red Sea attacks and 'virtual rape' investigated
description: The i reports on fears Red Sea attacks on ships will have a knock-on effect on key supplies to the UK.

title: Loony Dookers brave icy Forth for New Year's Day plunge
description: Swimmers have continued the traditional dip in the Firth of Forth to kick off 2024.

title: 'I was a gambling addict who stole £1.3m and went to prison'
description: Andy May, who has just got out of prison, wants to help other people with gambling addictions.

title: Fireworks and festivities as world welcomes 2024
description: People around the world gather to celebrate the new year, with fireworks shows in major cities.

title: In Pictures: New Year 2024 celebrations from around the world
description: From fireworks to meditation - here's how the world welcomed the new year.

title: BBC Sound Of 2024: Soul sensation Elmiene kicks off the countdown
description: Velvety smooth vocals and unabashedly intimate songs make the Oxford crooner one to watch in 2024.

title: Post Office scandal TV drama 'like a dream' say victims
description: Horizon victims hope a new mini-series will give their story the "oxygen it deserves".

title: Kiri Pritchard-Mclean and Rachel Fairburn talk serial killers
description: Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Rachel Fairburn share an interested in all things strange and macabre.

title: Disney's earliest Mickey and Minnie Mouse enter public domain as US copyright expires
description: Disney's copyright on the earliest version of the cartoon characters expires in the US on 1 January.

title: Red Sea: UK defence secretary says British forces will repel Houthi attacks
description: The defence secretary says British forces are "willing to take direct action" to protect the key shipping lane.

title: Alarm in Kanazawa as city rocked by earthquake
description: Japan has been hit by a series of earthquakes, prompting evacuation orders and tsunami warnings.

title: Muhammad Yunus: Nobel laureate sentenced to jail in Bangladesh
description: Supporters of the Bangladeshi economist say the case against him is politically motivated.

title: Cerne Abbas Giant: Has the mystery of the chalk hill figure been solved?
description: The origins of the Cerne Abbas Giant hill figure are unravelled by Oxford academics.

title: Migrant Channel crossings fell in 2023, official data says
description: Government figures show 29,437 people crossed the Channel in 2023, down 36% on 2022.

title: Greater Manchester Police officer charged with child sex attack
description: PC Dean Dempster, 34, is charged with the sexual assault of a child under 13 and misconduct.

title: Microsoft boss changes tune after criticism of UK
description: Brad Smith had said the UK was bad for business after a takeover of Activision was initially blocked.

title: Disney's Coco voice actor Ana Ofelia Murguía dies aged 90
description: Ana Ofelia Murguía voiced great-grandmother Mama Coco in the Oscar-winning animation.

title: King and Queen at Sandringham church for New Year? s Eve service
description: Charles and Camilla wave at onlookers as they visit St Mary Magdalene Church in Sandringham.

title: Period pants could get cheaper after VAT is removed
description: Shoppers will no longer pay VAT on period pants following a campaign by charities and retailers.

title: Cheadle murder arrest after two women found dead
description: The women, aged 91 and 63, were discovered at a house in Staffordshire on New Year's Eve.

title: Ukraine war: Zelensky promises more Ukraine-made weapons in new year speech
description: The Ukrainian president's message comes as five people were killed in attacks early on New Year's Day.

title: Cancer: Almost three million tested in England
description: Record numbers are being tested for cancer but treatment targets are still being missed in England.

title: The Birmingham child who paved the way for the heel prick test
description: Sheila Jones, who had Phenylketonuria (PKU), was treated by pioneering doctors 70 years ago.

title: Australia veteran David Warner retires from ODI cricket
description: The veteran player, aged 37, made the announcement in the lead-up to his final Test match.

title: Taiwan and China will 'surely be reunified' says Xi in New Year's Eve address
description: The Chinese leader's New Year's Eve message comes just weeks ahead of Taiwan's crucial general election.

title: Liverpool 4-2 Newcastle: Mohamed Salah scores twice for Premier League leaders

title: Luke Littler v Rob Cross: Teenager confident of winning PDC World Darts Championship
description: Teenager Luke Littler says he has what it takes to win the PDC World Championship as he prepares for a semi-final against Rob Cross.

title: Leicester City 4-1 Huddersfield Town: Tom Cannon scores twice as Foxes go 10 points clear at top of Championship
description: Tom Cannon scores twice, his first goals for Leicester, as they thrash Huddersfield to go 10 points clear at the top of the Championship.

title: January transfer window: Who could be on the move?
description: The January transfer window is open and several players have been linked with a move to and from Premier League clubs.

title: Melissa Hoskins: Tributes paid to former Olympic cyclist after car death
description: Tributes are paid to two-time Olympian Melissa Hoskins following her death in Adelaide, Australia after being hit by a car.

title: Liverpool 4-2 Newcastle: Eddie Howe 'confused' by penalty decisions in Anfield defeat
description: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe is "confused" by the two penalties awarded to Liverpool and one not awarded to his side in their 4-2 Premier League defeat at Anfield.

title: United Cup: Great Britain out as Australia beat United States
description: Great Britain miss out on the United Cup quarter-finals as Australia qualify from Group C with a 2-1 victory over the United States.
